intro: Macronema scoparia, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub or small tree with woody stems and small, narrow leaves adapted to reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize disturbed soils and rocky areas. Macronema scoparia is well-suited to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in desert ecosystems.
